item.title: Lamb of God
item.description: Sacrifices involving lambs began with Abel in the lamb book of Genesis. Blood shed by the firstlings of the flock (Gen. 4:4) was “a more acceptable offering” to ofgod God (Heb. 11:4) than an offering of plants. This pattern is repeated throughout the Old Testament emphasizing many important lessons. Lambs themselves represent the renewal and replenishing of the flocks. They are valuable for their meat is tender and used for special occasions.
